newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Rail ups rights offers to 600 mln rand.
newsitem.headline: Rail ups rights offers to 600 mln rand.

text.p: South Africa's Real Africa Investments Ltd and Real Africa Holdings Ltd said on Monday they were raising their previously announced rights offers to about 600 million rand.
Originally Real Africa Investments had planned to raise 150 million rand and Real Africa Holdings 300 million rand. Now they will raise 199 million rand and 402 million rand respectively.
"In the light of the positive response received from investors it has been resolved to increse the amounts to be raised," the firms said in a statement.

The purpose of the RAH rights offer at 450 cents a share is to raise capital in order to pay for acquisitions previously made, to fund increased shareholdings in existing underlying investments and to fund fututre investment opportunities.
The RAI rights offer at 530 cents a share is to is to enable RAI to follow its rights in the RAH rights offer.
Rail is a black empowerment investment vehicle.
The move is the latest in a flood of recent cash calls by some of South Africa's biggest firms hungry to tap investors for new funds.
